examples: I'll come tomorrow, if you wish (it).
I wish it to be known that I wish them all to leave the company.
Anyone who wish es an aisle seat should see an attendant.

definitions.definition: To hope (+ object clause with may or in present subjunctive).
To hope (for a particular outcome), even if that outcome is unlikely to occur or cannot occur.
examples: I wish I could go back in time and teach myself what I know now.

definitions.definition: To bestow (a thought or gesture) towards (someone or something).
examples: We wish you a merry Christmas .

definitions.definition: To request or desire to do an activity.
examples: Anyone who wish es to may leave now.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , followed by to and an infinitive

definitions.definition: To recommend; to seek confidence or favour on behalf of.

secondary_definitions: ( transitive , now rare ) To hope (+ object clause with may or in present subjunctive).
( intransitive , followed by for ) To hope (for a particular outcome), even if that outcome is unlikely to occur or cannot occur.
( ditransitive ) To bestow (a thought or gesture) towards (someone or something).
( intransitive , followed by to and an infinitive ) To request or desire to do an activity.
( transitive ) To recommend; to seek confidence or favour on behalf of.
